_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Supermarkets and Other Grocery (except Convenience) Stores

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The stationary source is defined as the 99 Cents Only Stores, Inc.distribution center located at 23623 Colonial Parkway, Katy, Texas, 77493.  99 Cents Only Stores, Inc.distributes products to locals stores and is equipped with a refrigeration system containing anhydrous ammonia, C.A.S. #7664-41-7.  Ammonia is the only regulated substance used at this facility.  The refrigeration system contains approximately 25000 pounds of ammonia.

ACCENDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION

Releases are prevented by a combination of engineering and administrative controls.  Engineering controls include automated system shutdown when safe parameters are exceeded.  Administrative controls involve manual isolation and shutdown procedures to be performed by trained personnel.  The system is also equipped with pressure relief valves that operate to prevent damage to system components should pressures reach unsafe levels.  Operation of pressure relief valves will result in a controlled release of refrigerant.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

This facility has developed a prevention program which complies with the requirements of OSHA CFR 29, 1910.119, Process Safety Management.  This program includes procedures, training, and proactive maintenance measures to keep the system operating without catastrophic release.

EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN

The Emergency Action Plan for this facility calls for the immediate evacuation or shelter in place as determined necessary for the particular event.  A third party response contractor is notified of an uncontrolled release event.  The local fire department has been included in the notification and response plan.

99 Cents Only Stores, Inc. personnel are trained to assist the responders with information only, and would not participate in the actual response.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no accidental releases or reportable incidents at this facility in over 5 years.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFET

Y

There are no planned changes to the system at this time.  However, any changes will include the latest technology for safety when installed
